;周五，塞浦路斯法院认定一名在家中杀死生病妻子的英国男子犯有过失杀人罪，并称检方未能毫无疑问地证明这名 76 岁男子犯有预谋谋杀罪。

;

;三名法官在一项一致裁决中表示，大卫·亨特 (David Hunter) 窒息其 74 岁妻子贾妮丝 (Janice) 的决定2021 年 12 月，当她坐在躺椅上时，他突然做出了决定：他再也无法忍受看到她在痛苦中哭泣，因此勃然大怒。

;

;法院接受了证人证词，称珍妮丝担心自己的血液疾病会发展成全面的白血病，并多次恳求她的丈夫结束她的生命，因为她不想分享死于该病的姐姐的命运。

;

;亨特试图自杀法庭获悉，他在做了“他以前从未想过的事情——用手捂住妻子的嘴和鼻子”后服用了大量药物，但医护人员救了他的命。

;

;法庭引用了专家的证词，称珍妮丝·亨特患有骨髓增生异常综合征，这是一种血癌，“在很大程度上”——高达 45%——可能会变成白血病，尽管没有证据表明她确实患有这种疾病，因为没有进行明确的测试。

;

;但是法院表示，夫妻双方都相信珍妮丝会因为姐姐的命运而患上这种疾病。

;

;目前在瑞士合法的辅助自杀吊舱可提供“无痛死亡”

;

;法院还承认，大卫·亨特“爱他的妻子，即使在最困难的情况下也毫无怨言地照顾她”，其行为只是为了结束她的痛苦，而且珍妮丝曾多次要求他结束她的生命。

;

;大卫·亨特早些时候向珍妮丝保证他会提供帮助。法院称，她实现了结束生命、不再受苦的愿望，并不表明有任何预谋。

;

;法院将于 7 月 27 日重新开庭，在宣判前提出减刑请求。这一判决意味着亨特避免了预谋谋杀罪所判处的最高无期徒刑。

;

;来自Justice Abroad（一个为在国外面临法律麻烦的英国人辩护的组织）的迈克尔·波拉克表示，该裁决允许法院判处缓刑，考虑到亨特已经被拘留的时间，这是适当的。

;

;他在妻子去世后立即被拘留，并在监狱里度过了一年半的时间，等待审判。

;

;“这仍然是一个悲惨的案例。珍妮丝和大卫的恋爱关系已有50多年，很明显，大卫是出于对珍妮丝的爱而在珍妮丝的要求下才这么做的，”波拉克在一份声明中说。

;

;“我们坚信，大卫在尼科西亚监狱里再呆下去不会有任何正当目的。”

;

;检方表示，塞浦路斯当局不想为任何丈夫开杀妻的先例，并在事后声称杀戮是在妻子同意的情况下进行的。

;

;国家检察官安德烈亚斯·哈吉基鲁 (Andreas Hadjikyrou) 告诉记者，司法部长将审查判决，以期提出上诉。他说，审查的一个关键点是证明这对夫妇确实同意大卫·亨特结束他妻子的生命。

;

; Fri, 21 Jul 2023 21:50:02 +0800 As indebted governments boost military spending, what about climate change and other pressing needs?https://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3228393/indebted-governments-boost-military-spending-what-about-climate-change-and-other-pressing-needs?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.21 21:30;
;;

;随着俄罗斯在乌克兰的愤世嫉俗的“特别军事行动”的持续进行，生命、美元和全球食品贸易混乱的直接损失继续增加。据基尔研究所称，截至 5 月底，对乌克兰的军事和人道主义支持成本已升至 1850 亿美元。

;

;但更令人担忧的是，间接成本高达数万亿美元，特别是在各国政府以国家安全名义增加国防预算的情况下。对于武器生产商来说，他们的游说工作从未如此轻松且富有成效。但很少有公民能够分享他们的喜悦。

;

;令人沮丧的现实是，在国防和军事上花费的每一美元都无法用于其他紧迫的需求。这意味着没有资金来应对气候变化或建设替代化石燃料和阻止全球变暖所需的可再生能源基础设施。

;

;这意味着“富裕”世界更加拖延，没有兑现每年向奋力摆脱困境的发展中经济体提供 1000 亿美元气候融资的承诺——有时是字面上的。

;

;这意味着没有资金可以在 Covid-19 后重建医疗保健，并保护我们免受下一次大流行的影响。它是世界各地政府预算大幅紧缩的一个主要因素，很少有政治领导人清楚新的国防资金将来自哪里，以及必须削减哪些支出。通胀飙升导致偿债成本飙升，使这一挑战变得更加严峻。

;

;俄罗斯入侵乌克兰后，德国是最先增加军费开支的国家之一，德国总理奥拉夫·肖尔茨 (Olaf Scholz) 在有关 Zeitenwende（开启新时代）的演讲中承诺增加 1000 亿欧元（1120 亿美元）（具体时间框架不明确）。此后，许多欧洲国家纷纷效仿，承诺将国防开支增加到冷战以来的最高水平。

;

;大多数国家承诺将军事预算提高到至少占国内生产总值的 2%。北约曾经的军费目标——历史上被大多数成员国忽视——正在成为支出下限。斯德哥尔摩国际和平研究所 (SIPRI) 去年记录的欧洲国防开支增长幅度已经相当可观——例如，比利时增长了 13%，荷兰和瑞典增长了 12%，波兰增长了 11%。

;

;很少有欧洲政府明确说明这些额外资金将来自何处，但占 GDP 的 2% 可能是一个坚定的目标。在法国，总统埃马纽埃尔·马克龙刚刚承诺在 2024 年至 2030 年的预算期内将军费开支增加 40%，达到 4130 亿欧元（4600 亿美元），批评者嘲笑他建立了“一支盆景军队”——拥有多种能力，但规模很小。

;

;马克龙和其他欧洲领导人如何巧妙地履行这些承诺，以应对巨额政府债务和削减开支的巨大政治压力（请注意法国因努力而引发的街头骚乱）削减养老金支出）仍不清楚。

;

;乌克兰，诚然属于自己的一类，去年的军费开支增长了 640％，达到 440 亿美元，显然不知道如何满足战争和重建的最终成本。

;

;在欧洲之外，日本和澳大利亚都承诺大幅增加国防开支，这在一定程度上是受乌克兰战争的推动。在日本，岸田政府计划到 2027 年将国防开支从占国内生产总值的 1.1% 提高到 2%，每年增加约 360 亿美元。

;

;根据《奥库斯协议》，澳大利亚政府致力于扩大其在亚洲的军事影响力，但据澳大利亚战略政策研究所称，由于预算紧张，澳大利亚政府将不得不“在未来四年内得不到任何额外资金的支持”。但从 2027 年开始，国防经费将开始增加：从目前占政府支出的 8.2% 增加到 2032 年的 9.7%。

;

;新核潜艇需要 90 亿澳元（60 亿美元），加强北部军事基地需要 38 亿澳元，发展远程打击能力需要 25 亿澳元，“加强太平洋参与”需要 9.24 亿澳元，因此军费支出的增加可能是永久性的，而且会以其他服务的成本。

;

;当然，最大的单一资金转移将来自美国，其去年的军费开支为 8,770 亿美元，令其他所有国家相形见绌。它占全球军费开支的39%，占美国联邦开支的12%，几乎占美国政府可自由支配开支的一半​​。

;

;尽管做出了这一巨大承诺，美国仍然是乌克兰最大的单一支持者（去年为199亿美元），美国国防部正在迫切要求额外提供300亿美元用于军需品和3150亿美元用于新武器。由于美国对“国家安全”的政治痴迷只会在明年总统选举前夕增强，毫无疑问这些额外资金的需求将会得到满足。

;

;所需资金从何而来则是另一回事：国家债务高达 32 万亿美元，共和党和民主党在如何削减开支以增加国防开支的问题上陷入争执。

;

;回顾这一看似不可抗拒的长期全球形势，由于国防开支大幅增加（每年可能达到数千亿美元）的长期压力，只有一组结论是明确的。政府债务将继续上升，满足所有其他紧迫需求的资金面临危险，富裕国家在未来充满挑战的十年中帮助发展中国家的承诺是空洞的。德国的 Scholz 关于 Zeitenwende 的说法是正确的。

;

;在频繁的气候冲击和全球市场不确定的情况下，中国高层官员誓言要加强农田保护，更好地利用大片盐碱地，作为北京粮食安全行动的一部分。

;

;据国家支持的新华社报道，在习近平主席周四主持的一次会议上，开垦新农田并提高其质量成为首要议程，因为人们对粮食自给自足的担忧14亿人口增加。

;

;习近平在中央财经委员会会议上表示，以盐碱地等“非传统农田”为目标，开展农田开垦，需要“不断拓展农业生产空间”。

;

;在此次讨论之前，农业官员周五警告称，继201年以来夏季产量首次下降后，中国秋收正面临预期极端气候事件的“极其严峻挑战”

;

;农业农村部官员表示，今年早些时候，受恶劣天气影响，全国部分地区出现旱涝灾害，病虫害问题日益突出。

;

;农业农村部农作物生产司司长潘文波表示，“今年以来，我国天气确实出现了明显的异常现象。”

;

;“黄河、淮河地区收获前遭遇罕见降雨，部分地区出现了罕见的雨涝灾害。”入夏以来，北方地区持续高温。”

;

;北京应对风险的主要措施之一是增加播种面积，而这需要充足的耕地。

;

;习近平在周四的会议上说：“耕地是粮食生产的命脉。”

;

;尽管扭转了过去两年耕地面积下降的趋势，但“保护耕地的任务没有变轻，反而更重” ”，习近平补充道。

;

;在高度重视粮食安全的情况下，到2022年，中国粮食年产量已连续八年保持在6.5亿吨以上。

;

;根据去年发布的中央政府农业五年规划，北京的目标是至少保持这一水平，并在2025年将其提高到7亿吨。

;

;随着汞的上升，气候变化是否会影响能源、贸易和农业？

;< p>;但今年的前景因夏季单产下降0.9%而蒙上阴影，这主要是由于种植面积最大的省份河南省成熟小麦在收获前长时间降雨造成的。

;

;潘补充道，不过，中国的粮食库存仍然充足，水稻和小麦储备处于“相对较高的水平”，可以支撑全年的消费。

;

;中国近年来投资利用不太适宜的土地来扩大总种植面积，其中包括受可溶性物质损害的土壤。 pH值较高的盐土或粘土，称为盐碱土。

;

;盐土，没问题。中国庆祝油菜籽产量创历史新高，推动粮食安全

;

;据官方和官方媒体广泛引用的数据，中国拥有超过 3300 万公顷（8150 万英亩）的可用盐碱土，其中约三分之一适合耕种。

;

;据中央电视台 5 月报道，研究人员已开发出 40 多项处理盐碱土的技术以及 50 多种耐盐作物品种。

;

;5 月，一家国家研究机构山东省还开展盐碱地改良利用工作，力争三年培育农作物新品种80个。

; Fri, 21 Jul 2023 21:50:02 +0800 Tech war: Dutch chip equipment giant ASML buoyed by Chinese demand ahead of new export curbshttps://www.scmp.com/tech/tech-war/article/3228531/tech-war-dutch-chip-equipment-giant-asml-buoyed-chinese-demand-ahead-new-export-curbs?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.21 21:00;
;;

;ASML控股公司顶住了半导体行业的低迷，并因中国客户的强劲需求而上调了全年销售前景，而限制措施可能会进一步阻碍中国获得该公司的先进技术。

;

;在收入超出预期（中国占出货量的24%）后，这家半导体设备制造商将2023年净销售额增长预期上调至30%左右

;

;ASML 首席执行官彼得·温尼克 (Peter Wennink) 表示，虽然由于宏观经济状况不佳以及缺乏熟练工人来启动和运行新设施，导致 ASML 先进的极紫外 (EUV) 光刻机向美国和台湾的交付速度有所放缓，但该公司发现中国大陆对其旧产品的需求巨大。

;

;过去两年，ASML 只能满足中国对其更成熟技术的设备需求的不到 50%，但他表示，这种情况正在发生变化。

;

;“任何不运往其他国家的产品都会运往中国，但到 2024 年仍有一些需求，因为我们今天仍然没有达到 100% 的填充率。”Wennink 在周三的投资者电话会议上表示。

;

;在美国的压力下，该公司目前不向中国出售其 EUV 光刻系统，但它继续向该国的客户运送其不太先进的深紫外 (DUV) 系统。

;

; p>;

;“我们的中国客户表示：‘我们很乐意采用别人不想要的机器’，因为他们的晶圆厂已经准备好，他们可以采用可用的工具，”Wennick 在该公司发布的视频采访中表示。

;

;据《华盛顿邮报》2 月份报道，在美国、日本和荷兰同意协调出口限制后，中国半导体制造商一直在争先恐后地储备芯片制造设备。

;

;从 9 月份开始，荷兰当局将要求 ASML 申请许可证交付其更高端的 DUV 系统，例如 Twinscan NXT: 2000i，该系统可用于生产先进的 7 纳米和 5 纳米芯片。然而，美国主导的出口限制阻碍了中国生产如此规模芯片的目标。

;

;北京谴责华盛顿“胁迫”盟友对中国实施技术封锁，并“破坏市场规则和国际贸易”。

;

;温尼克表示，他预计新规则对该公司的影响可以忽略不计，因为不断加剧的地缘政治紧张局势和全球对成熟芯片的需求将维持中国从 ASML 的设备采购。

;

;研究公司Third Bridge分析师Albie Amankona也认为，荷兰出口管制对ASML的销售目标影响有限。他表示：“未来几年，EUV 和 DUV 机器的需求预计将超过供应。”

;

;不过，Amankona 警告称，ASML“正在错失一个充满希望的增长市场，因为中国政府大力投资半导体行业”。

;

;Wennink 表示，ASML 正在关注有关美国正在寻求扩大对中国先进半导体技术出口限制的报道，但他预计美国任何潜在的额外措施都不会对该公司的财务前景产生重大影响。年。

;香港领导人周五对香港最高外交官表示，如果一项有争议的核废水处理计划继续实施，对来自日本 10 个县的海鲜实施潜在禁令是防范健康风险的“必要”步骤。

;

;这一警告是在行政长官李家超与总领事冈田健一举行的闭门会议上发出的，该会议讨论了日本的问题计划最早从 8 月起将福岛核电站处理后的废水排入太平洋。

;

;李在健一要求的交流中表示，30 年来处理大量核废水的“史无前例”计划将给食品安全和环境造成“不可避免的风险”。

;

;日本海鲜禁令不会对香港餐馆提供赔偿：环境局长：东京方面坚称处理后的废水在经过处理后是安全的。

;

;李说：“如果日方坚持排放，香港政府必须采取措施，保​​障食品安全，保障香港市民的健康。” “此类措施是必要且必要的。”

;

;市政府表示，他们愿意与日本政府进一步讨论这一情况。

;

;香港早些时候警告称，出于安全考虑，将禁止从东京、福岛、千叶、栃木、茨城、群马、宫城、新泻、长野和埼玉等 10 个县进口所有水产品。

;

;他们还将要求 5 个县 - 福岛、千叶、日本ba、群马、茨城和栃木 - 为其他类型的食品出口提供辐射证书。

;

;官方数据显示，去年从日本进口的主要食品约占香港食品供应总量的2％，其中本地消费的所有海鲜的6.75％来自该国。

;

;一些专家对该提案的理由表示担忧，因为该提案包括四个内陆县，而一名日本官员则指责香港“试图赢得布朗尼”

;

;山东省交通运输厅周四宣布，将调查东部沿海省份高铁线路的施工质量问题指控。

;

;此前有媒体报道称，连接山东中部莱西市和沿海荣成的高铁线路存在质量问题，该线路全长 193 公里（120 英里）。

;

;中国国家铁路局下属的《经济参考报》新华社周四上午发表调查报道称，该项目的承包商举报主承包商国有中建八局在施工过程中涉嫌偷工减料。

;

;举报人称，该铁路部分路段的大部分施工桩不符合设计要求，存在安全风险。

;

;《经济参考报》称，他们已前往该铁路线进行实地考察，并在专业人士的帮助下证实了举报人的举报。

;

;

;北京报纸援引专家的话说，中建八局使用小于设计长度的螺纹桩可以节省资金，但“可能会造成地基失稳，造成永久性伤害和安全隐患，威胁铁路安全”。

;

;接受该报采访的现场施工人员表示，他们早就知道减产的消息，但被中建八局要求保持安静。

;

;上海铁路监督管理部门也表示已派出工作组前往调查。周四。

;

;周四下午，中建八局表示也将展开调查。

;

;中国自2008年以来一直在积极建设连接全国主要城市的高铁，并在三年内拥有了世界上最长的高铁网络。

;

;但北京的高铁扩建在2011年之后短暂停止，当时的铁道部部长刘志军因腐败被拘留。 2013年，他被指控收受价值6460万元人民币（890万美元）的贿赂，被判处死刑，缓期两年执行。

;

;2011年7月，东部省份浙江省发生一起高铁相撞事故，造成40人死亡、172人受伤，引发了人们对铁路线安全和政府处理该事件的质疑。随后，中国各地高铁降低了运营速度。

;

;2013年，中国当局撤销了铁道部，将其职责移交给交通运输部下属的国家铁路局和国有的中国铁路总公司。 2014年大规模恢复高铁建设。

;美国铁路计划能否吸引中东国家退出中国的“一带一路”？

;地方政府将高铁视为提振经济的重要途径。

;

;新华社今年早些时候表示，中国高铁网络总长度已达到 42,000 公里。

; Fri, 21 Jul 2023 20:20:01 +0800 Judge warns ‘Glory to Hong Kong’ protest song ban might not have effect government wantshttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/law-and-crime/article/3228517/judge-warns-court-hearing-glory-hong-kong-protest-song-ban-might-not-have-effect-government-wants?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.21 18:53;
;;

;Proposed restrictions on a Hong Kong song popular during the 2019 anti-government protests may not accomplish what the city authorities want to achieve, a judge has told a hearing on the unprecedented application.

;

;Mr Justice Anthony Chan Kin-keung on Friday told the High Court an injunction against “Glory to Hong Kong” might not work differently from the Beijing-imposed 2020 national security law to sanction people who published or promoted the song with seditious intent.

;

;The judge added that the proposed order might also fall foul of the legal prohibition on double jeopardy and subject offenders to punishments for a criminal offence and civil contempt.

;

;But if the anti-government tune presented a national security threat that would outweigh any risk of a “chilling effect” a ban might create, he said.

;

;“I would have thought that given the importance of national security, [in] balancing against the chilling effect, I suppose, it wouldn't be a very difficult exercise to rule in favour of national security,” the judge said.

;

;But Chan, also approved by Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu to hear national security cases, added: “That is assuming the injunction is effective and serves the [intended] purpose.”

;

;The court is expected to hand down its ruling next Friday after it hears arguments for and against the application in a three-hour session.

;

;Secretary for Justice Paul Lam Ting-kwok filed the legal bid last month to outlaw the promotion of “Glory to Hong Kong” through “broadcasting, performing, printing, publishing, selling, offering for sale, distributing, disseminating, displaying or reproducing in any way”.

;

;Government officials believe the injunction is needed to convince internet search giant Google to remove content which they said had played a major part in a series of blunders where the tune was played instead of the national anthem “March of the Volunteers” at overseas sports events.

;

;Lam earlier asked anyone who wanted to oppose the proposal to take part in the court proceedings.

;

;Journalists to be exempt from 'Glory to Hong Kong' ban if government wins legal bid

;

;But an attempt by jailed activist Chow Hang-tung to join the hearing as a party was rejected by the court on the grounds she lacked legal standing in the case.

;

;The court instead engaged an independent lawyer to provide opinions on the merits of the government's contentions as an amicus curiae – a “friend of the court”.

;

;Senior Counsel Benjamin Yu, who appeared for the justice minister, said the city leader insisted the song would continue to be used and circulated in ways that undermined national security unless it was banned by the court.

;

;Yu said an injunction would make “a material difference” and highlighted that the city's airport and railway services had benefited from court orders after they were embroiled in the chaos and violence of 2019.

;

;He emphasised the ban was not intended to target “lawful” journalistic activity or penalise anyone who used the song for innocent purposes.

;

;Yu tried to ease judicial concerns about double punishment and highlighted the courts would still play a gatekeeping role and be able to decide whether to allow the justice secretary to start contempt proceedings against individuals.

;

;Hongkongers free to speak up about proposed ban on protest song: justice chief

;

;But Senior Counsel Abraham Chan Lok-shung, who was asked to give independent views at the hearing, said a ban would add the unnecessary risk of a defendant possibly having to face two trials over a single unlawful act.

;

;Chan argued the move was counterproductive and highlighted the surge of interest in the song after the ban bid was filed.

;

;He added a prohibition on the song could not compel Google or other platforms to censor their content because the government only wanted to punish use of the song for illegal purposes rather than impose a blanket ban.

;

;“How would this order … demonstrate the content is in violation of Hong Kong law? It simply doesn't serve the function that is hoped for,” Chan argued.

;

;He told the court the national security law was a sufficient deterrent and that the proposed injunction would not add anything of substance to public education or compliance with the law.

;

;“If the government considers it necessary to ramp up measures to promote so-called public awareness or consciousness, generally or specifically in terms of the song, why can't it do that by enhancing and supplementing its efforts in other areas?” Chan said.

; Fri, 21 Jul 2023 19:20:02 +0800 China’s 57 million military veterans in line for better support with new dedicated civil service rankshttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/politics/article/3228476/chinas-57-million-military-veterans-line-better-support-new-dedicated-civil-service-ranks?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.21 19:00;
;;

;China has identified six pilot zones to train thousands of veterans affairs specialists – a new public service position created to help the country's 57 million retired military personnel find jobs and better livelihood support.

;

;This is the first time that China is training public officials to cater specifically to ex-service personnel. Working under the Ministry of Veterans Affairs, the specialists will be permanent civil servants tasked with managing the vast network of veterans' service centres countrywide.

;

;The pilot zones include the city of Ordos in China's northern Inner Mongolia autonomous region, as well as Shanghai's Pudong district, Hangzhou in Zhejiang province and Quanzhou in Fujian province to the east. The remaining two are Guiyang in southwestern Guizhou province and Wuzhong in northwestern Ningxia Hui autonomous region.

;

;All six held training and graduation ceremonies for the first batch of veterans affairs specialists in recent weeks, online posts by local government agencies said.

;

;Addressing the programme's launch ceremony in Ordos on July 8, veterans affairs vice-minister Ma Feixiong said the graduating pilot team would offer “an innovative way to promote the efficiency of the service for veterans' support”.

;

;“It answers the practical needs of improving the ability and quality of grass-roots staff and [will] stabilise and expand the workforce. It will definitely provide effective assistance to promote the high-quality development of veterans' work,” Ma was quoted as saying by local media.

;

;China passes law to provide more support for former military personnel

;

;The Ministry of Veterans Affairs was set up in April 2018, following a number of protests by ex-military personnel over retirement benefits and perceived poor treatment of demobilised troops. These included demonstrations in Beijing in late 2016 and early 2017 by thousands of veterans, most of whom had fought in Vietnam in 1979 – China's last major foreign military operation.

;

;According to the ministry, there were about 110,000 members of staff and more than 970,000 full-time and part-time contract workers serving in over 624,000 local veterans' service centres as of the end of last year.

;

;The centres keep track of veterans within their jurisdictions, provide policy consultation, hear out their grievances and help them with resettlement, finding new jobs and supporting their business ventures.

;

;With the veterans affairs specialist position now under the ministry payroll, many of the contract workers, who are veterans themselves, would have a good chance to become full-time government employees.

;

;The millions of retired soldiers are also a vast manpower reserve for the Chinese military in case of war. Beijing has pledged to improve veterans' benefits in the latest five-year plan of 2021-25, amid what it sees as an increasingly hostile international environment.

;

;The Ministry of Veterans Affairs had helped more than 2.6 million ex-service personnel find jobs, officials told a press conference marking its five-year anniversary in April. They also said 8.5 billion yuan (US$1.19 billion) had been released to help 38.49 million veterans in need in the last three years.

;

;It had also worked with the Ministry of Education to bring over 1 million retired soldiers back to degree and diploma programmes since 2019, with exemptions from entrance exams.其中超过20,000人随后报名攻读硕士课程。 A total of 270,000 soldiers who postponed their studies to join military service had also returned to school to complete their courses, the veterans affairs ministry said.

; Fri, 21 Jul 2023 19:20:02 +0800 Contactless immigration proposed for planned port under Hong Kong’s Northern Metropolis schemehttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/hong-kong-economy/article/3228522/contactless-immigration-clearance-proposed-planned-port-under-hong-kongs-northern-metropolis-plan?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.21 19:01;
;;

;Hong Kong security authorities have proposed adopting a contactless immigration clearance channel at a planned port to facilitate cross-border travel between the city and mainland China under the Northern Metropolis scheme.

;

;Undersecretary for Security Michael Cheuk Hau-yip on Friday said contactless immigration clearance at the Fulin Small Boundary Control Point would allow research and development professionals from the mainland to travel to and from the Lok Ma Chau Loop without undergoing the usual checks after registration.

;

;The loop will be home to the Hong Kong-Shenzhen Innovation and Technology Park, which will be the largest of its kind and is expected to boost the city's global status in the field and serve as an incubator for start-ups.

;

;“The technology park will attract talent living on the mainland. Workers may need to make daily trips to the city for work and return,” Cheuk told a Legislative Council subcommittee meeting.

;

;“The Fulin Small Boundary Control Point will be completely contactless. People can simply go to and from the loop without any checks after registration.

;

;“At this stage, we are discussing [adopting the technology] with the mainland as people will not need to undergo checks even when they return to the mainland.”

;

;The new checkpoint was proposed by then chief executive Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor. The planned port is located at the easternmost part of the Lok Ma Chau Loop and the narrowest part of the Shenzhen River, the natural border between Hong Kong and the mainland.

;

;Hong Kong explores easier cross-border travel for talent to spur I&T hub growth

;

;In 2021, Lam said the proposed checkpoint would include innovative clearance procedures involving artificial intelligence to facilitate the movement of innovation and technology professionals.

;

;The proposed technology park is part of Lam's broader Northern Metropolis plan to create an international innovation and technology hub and housing for 2.5 million people in the northern New Territories.

;

;The metropolis would be connected by a railway-centred transport system linking different boundary checkpoints with Shenzhen.

;

;The Security Bureau on Friday said Hong Kong and Shenzhen authorities had completed the first phase of research to pursue a Hong Kong-Shenzhen Western Rail Link to connect Hung Shui Kiu in the city's northwest to Qianhai across the border.

;

;Hong Kong to look into completing rail link in Northern Metropolis earlier

;

;According to the government, the proposed cross-border railway would eventually offer a direct connection between Hong Kong International Airport and Shenzhen Bao'an International Airport.

;

;Cheuk said the bureau was participating in the next research stage, which involved looking into new immigration clearance models with Shenzhen to improve efficiency. He added that they aimed to achieve “collaborative inspection and joint clearance” so that visitors would only need to have their travel documents inspected once when going through checks on both sides.

;

;He also said many control points were being renovated at the moment, including in Lo Wu, Lok Ma Chau and Sha Tau Kok, to improve capacity.

;

;About 350,000 people use the city's seven land immigration control points daily, amounting to about 70 per cent of the pre-pandemic levels, according to official data.
